meanings.definition: Combine into a single, coherent whole.
meanings.sent1: She consolidated all her toys into one box.
meanings.sent2: The company consolidated its various departments into one unified team.
meanings.sent3: The magician consolidated all the scattered cards into a single deck.
meanings.sent4: His speech consolidated the diverse opinions into a clear message.
meanings.sent5: The artist consolidated the colors into a beautiful painting.

meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food can help consolidate your bones.
meanings.sent2: The treaty helped consolidate the peace between the two countries.
meanings.sent3: The glue consolidated the broken pieces back together.
meanings.sent4: Her determination consolidated her resolve to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The warm sunlight consolidated the snow into ice.

meanings.definition: Make something stronger or more solid.
meanings.sent1: Adding more cement will consolidate the foundation of the building.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk consolidated the team's confidence.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient consolidated the flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent4: Regular exercise can help consolidate your muscles.
meanings.sent5: The architect's design consolidated the structure of the bridge.
